title: 14 day ban for asking the flaming support who he said Kys to...
body: I simply asked who he was saying KYS to and he kept flaming me in all chat and telling people to report me cause i wasnt camping bot... he told people on my team to KYS and called us F@$ also... I personal dont think i should get a 14 ban for this..........

replies.body:
Just wanted to step in here real quick as Player Support and say that the player did indeed reach out to us and after chatting with them, the ban was removed.

As a reminder, you _**NEVER**_ have to or should repeat what other players say in-game that is considered offensive and punishable. The best action is to report them at the end of the game so the systems can review their account and behavior.

It's great that you reversed the ban, but this kind of stupid automatic ZERO TOLERANCE policy often results in dumb shit like this happening where innocents get unjustly punished.

The argument then becomes "should the system punish players for repeating zero tolerance phrases others use". The answer to this, based on Riot's statistics that show the community resoundingly does not approve of this type of repetition, is **yes**. Riot has years and years and hundreds of thousands, if not millions of reports that they can reference to determine what the community wants to see punished. For words/phrases on the "zero tolerance list", the community has shown through reporting that they do not approve of it being used **in any fashion** as the damage can be caused simply by *reminding* another player of the toxicity.

I think you might consider not typing anymore, you're not fit to advise anyone.

There's no need to be rude.  While you, and many others, may dislike or disagree with what he is saying and with the IFS in general, Chermorg is simply trying to explain how the system works, and what Riot's rationale is for why players who repeat toxic phrases are punished.   And that is the job of the Arbiters/Advisors.  To help players understand Riot's behavioral systems.  

He is not saying that he personally feels that the player should be banned for it; he didn't give his personal opinion on the player's specific case.  All he is saying is that in a general, broad sense, there isn't ever really a need to repeat toxicity.  Nothing is accomplished by it.  You don't need to get extra reports anymore, so you don't need to tell the enemy team.  And when the vast majority of the playerbase doesn't want to see toxicity in their games, it's more polite to your own teammates (the non-jackass ones) to not subject them to the rewind-replay of it.  

Of course players in situations like this one are not being toxic.  Anyone can tell from the logs that he/she isn't out to hurt anyone.  And because this is one of those situations, it's wonderful that the OP came here, and was directed to Player Support, so that this ban could be removed.  Despite what some people may complain about here, Support are reasonable people.  While they are going to make sure the player knows to not do this in the future, they aren't going to punish someone for toxicity if they weren't toxic.  And that's just one of the many reasons that there is the Behavioral Support Specialist team.  So that when the IFS encounters situations like this, there are people that players can turn to to sort them out.
